title: Phishing/Cyber Fraud — Online Payment Theft
summary: Complainant reports ₹50,000 debited from bank after clicking a suspicious link.

stages.info: Victim reports SMS with payment link; they clicked and entered OTP. Bank shows transfer at 23:10 same night.
stages.question: Immediate next step?
options: Request transaction logs and coordinate with bank
Ignore and mark as user error
stages.feedback_wrong: Coordinate with bank to obtain transaction logs and preserve evidence before it is lost.
stages.next_info: Bank provides transaction logs showing transfer to an account registered overseas; IP logs requested.

stages.info: Bank logs point to an intermediary exchanger wallet. IP logs show an access from a public cybercafe near victim's city at 22:58.
stages.question: What should you do next?
options: Request CCTV at the cybercafe and interview staff
Immediately seize all devices in the city
stages.feedback_wrong: CCTV and witness interviews at the cybercafe can help identify the user who used the machine.
stages.next_info: Cybercafe staff provides a log showing a user at 22:55; further leads follow.
